main.description: To add or remove an item from the loot filter, left-click the item in your inventory to hold it, then press the filter hotkey. Repeat the same step to unfilter the item. If you accidentally filter an item and can�t pick it up, press the hotkey (default Z) to temporarily disable the loot filter, then follow these steps to remove the filtered item.
key.addremove.name: Add/Remove Item to Filter List
key.addremove.tooltip: When the inventory menu is open, click an item to hold it, then press this hotkey. The item will be added to or removed from the loot filter list.
key.toggle.name: Toggle Loot Filter On/Off
key.toggle.tooltip: Pressing this hotkey turns the loot filter on or off. Useful when you accidentally filter an item you still want to pick up.
distance.name: #Tile Filtered Distance
distance.tooltip: Number of tiles (default 8) that filtered items will move away from the player.
removefiltered.name: Remove Filtered Items from Game
removefiltered.tooltip: If enabled, filtered items are deleted instead of dropped nearby.
devmode.name: Enable Developer Mode
devmode.tooltip: Shows extra debug logs in the console.
page.categoryfilters.name: Category-Based Filters (Override Item List)
page.categoryfilters.tooltip: Toggle broad categories like weapons, tools, artifacts, etc. These apply before the per-item loot filter list.
page.sortedlist.name: View/Edit Loot Filtered Items Alphabetically
page.sortedlist.tooltip: View and toggle individual filtered items, sorted alphabetically.
page.sortedlist.title: List Loot Filter Items Alphabetically
page.sortedlist.description: Items below are sorted alphabetically. Toggle to include or exclude them from auto-pickup.
item.entry.name: {{item}} ({{id}})
item.entry.tooltip: Toggle whether this item should be filtered.
page.categoryfilters.title: Category Filters
category.section.title: Category-Based Filters
category.section.tooltip: These options apply broad filters by item type or category.
category.section.description: If a category is enabled here, any matching item will be filtered even if it is not in the item-specific loot filter list.
category.main.title: Main Categories
category.main.description: These apply to broad item types such as weapons, tools, clothing, and object classes.
category.weapons.tooltip: Filter all melee weapons (swords, daggers, clubs, etc.).
category.tools.tooltip: Filter all tools (axes, pickaxes, hoes, watering cans, fishing rods, etc.).
category.objects.tooltip: Filter all object items (QualifiedItemId starting with (O)).
subcategory.title: Subcategories
subcategory.description: These categories use the game's object-type classifications (Fish, Milk, Monster Loot, etc.) for finer filtering.
subcategory.junk.tooltip: Filter all junk or trash items.
